title: Frame extraction failed. Video files must be corrupted.

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "traceback" and input code that you ran to hit this error. **Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, DLC version 2.1.10.1** Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using. Example: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut1.x or 2.x. Please complete the following information about your system: OS: [Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS] DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.10.1 Anaconda env used: True **Describe the problem** The videos I'm recording are in .avi format. I can create a new project pointing to an .avi file. However, when I try to extract frames, the function quits with the error Video could not be opened... import deeplabcut deeplabcut.create_new_project('FlyonBall','Ash',['/home/ashwin/Documents/Droso/fic_20210212_123845.avi'],copy_videos=False,videotype='.avi',multianimal=False) deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path,mode='automatic',algo='kmeans',crop=True,userfeedback=False)
Code output

Config file read successfully. Video could not be opened. Skipping... Frame extraction failed. Video files must be corrupted.

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Install deeplabcut: conda create -n DLC python=3.7 tensorflow=1.13.1 conda activate DLC pip install deeplabcut conda install -c anaconda wxpython ##(pip install -U wxPython==4.0.7.post2 #exits installation with errors) 2. Create new project using an .avi video: deeplabcut.create_new_project('FlyonBall','Ash',['/home/ashwin/Documents/Droso/fic_20210212_123845.avi'],copy_videos=False,videotype='.avi',multianimal=False) 3. extract Frames: deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path,mode='automatic',algo='kmeans',crop=True,userfeedback=False) 4. See error Config file read successfully. Video could not be opened. Skipping... Frame extraction failed. Video files must be corrupted. **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. **Additional context** The extract frames function runs when I convert my .avi to .mp4 using ffmpeg in Ubuntu, and then pointing to the .mp4 file instead during create_new_project(). Perhaps this is an openCV issue? When I set the field deeplabcut.extract_frames(...,opencv=False), I get the following error messages: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/ashwin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/moviepy/video/io/ffmpeg_reader.py", line 291, in ffmpeg_parse_infos match = re.findall("([0-9][0-9]:[0-9][0-9]:[0-9][0-9].[0-9][0-9])", line)[0] IndexError: list index out of range During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/ashwin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/gui/extract_frames.py", line 243, in extract_frames slider_width=slider_width, File "/home/ashwin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/frame_extraction.py", line 216, in extract_frames clip = VideoFileClip(video) File "/home/ashwin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/moviepy/video/io/VideoFileClip.py", line 91, in __init__ fps_source=fps_source) File "/home/ashwin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/moviepy/video/io/ffmpeg_reader.py", line 33, in __init__ fps_source) File "/home/ashwin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/moviepy/video/io/ffmpeg_reader.py", line 296, in ffmpeg_parse_infos filename, infos)) OSError: MoviePy error: failed to read the duration of file /home/ashwin/Documents/Droso/fic_20210212_123845.avi. Here are the file infos returned by ffmpeg: ffmpeg version 4.2.2-static https://johnvansickle.com/ffmpeg/ Copyright (c) 2000-2019 the FFmpeg developers built with gcc 8 (Debian 8.3.0-6) configuration: --enable-gpl --enable-version3 --enable-static --disable-debug --disable-ffplay --disable-indev=sndio --disable-outdev=sndio --cc=gcc --enable-fontconfig --enable-frei0r --enable-gnutls --enable-gmp --enable-libgme --enable-gray --enable-libaom --enable-libfribidi --enable-libass --enable-libvmaf --enable-libfreetype --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libopencore-amrnb --enable-libopencore-amrwb --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-librubberband --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libsrt --enable-libvorbis --enable-libopus --enable-libtheora --enable-libvidstab --enable-libvo-amrwbenc --enable-libvpx --enable-libwebp --enable-libx264 --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libdav1d --enable-libxvid --enable-libzvbi --enable-libzimg libavutil 56. 31.100 / 56. 31.100 libavcodec 58. 54.100 / 58. 54.100 libavformat 58. 29.100 / 58. 29.100 libavdevice 58. 8.100 / 58. 8.100 libavfilter 7. 57.100 / 7. 57.100 libswscale 5. 5.100 / 5. 5.100 libswresample 3. 5.100 / 3. 5.100 libpostproc 55. 5.100 / 55. 5.100 Input #0, avi, from '/home/ashwin/Documents/Droso/fic_20210212_123845.avi': Duration: N/A, start: 0.000000, bitrate: N/A Stream #0:0: Video: mjpeg (Baseline) (MJPG / 0x47504A4D), yuvj420p(pc, bt470bg/unknown/unknown), 1376x1376 [SAR 1:1 DAR 1:1], 66 fps, 66 tbr, 66 tbn, 66 tbc At least one output file must be specified
